item.description:
Attachment theory was first developed in researching a child's behavior with a care giver.  Scientists found 3 broad categories of behaviors on how a child dealt with separation from a caregiver. 

In more recent decades, research has explored how these working models of behavior may influence our romantic relationships as adults. 

For this event, we explore the topic with a smaller group with more in depth discussions.  This will be a hosted pot luck dinner. We'll also explore some of the issues that arise with relationships between romantic partners from different categories.    This will be a mix of a quiz,  presentations and discussion.  We will look into how one can determine what attachment style a potential partner has.  Some of the materiel comes from a recent book on the subject: Attached, by Levine & Heller.  I'll be drawing information from other articles, as well.
item.how_to_find_us: The address for the potluck will be emailed to the participants.
item.why: because it is in our nature....
item.name: Attached?
